title: Embedded Engineer - Senzime AB
description:
**Senzime - A global medical device company**


At Senzime, our mission is to safeguard every patient's journey, from anesthesia to recovery. We are an innovative medical device company specializing in precision-based patient monitoring solutions. We market an innovative portfolio of solutions, including the TetraGraph, for real-time neuromuscular blockade and recovery monitoring.

  

Our success is built on the strength of our team. We believe in fostering a culture of transparency, integrity and accountability, we are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels heard and valued.

**Join Our Team as a Senior Embedded Engineer!**


Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology, system architecture, and embedded systems? We are looking for a talented **Embedded Engineer** to join our dynamic team and help shape the future of innovative solutions.

**What You'll Do:**

* **Design & Development**: Create and refine embedded software and architecture for advanced products.
* **Drive Product Development**: Contribute to the entire product lifecycle, from conception to delivery.
* **Ensure Quality**: Lead documentation, testing, and troubleshooting to ensure the highest standards.
* **Innovate**: Continuously improve processes and products within your area of responsibility.

**Get Involved In:**

* Selecting the best development tools to optimize efficiency and outcomes.
* System architecture design, ensuring scalable and robust solutions.
* Conducting pre-studies and technical research for next-generation products.
* Building prototypes that bring ideas to life.
* Developing a more automated CI/CD testing environment
* Investigating complaints and driving solutions for continuous improvement.

**What We're Looking For:**

* At least 3-5 years of experience in embedded systems and architecture software design.
* Strong knowledge in C/C++, python and in Linux systems.
* Knowledge in HIL and CI/CD systems.
* Solid understanding in electronic systems.
* Experience in embedded RTOS systems.
* Strong knowledge of signal processing in embedded systems.
* Proven track record in troubleshooting, testing, and product development.
* Proficiency in selecting and working with development tools.
* Ability to propose and implement changes to enhance company processes and products.
* Experience in the Medical Devices industry is considered a plus
* A team player with excellent problem-solving and communication skills

**Application**


Please send your application at the latest May 18th **2025.**

title: Supplier Quality Engineer (Mechanics)
description:
For our Supply Chain Department, we are now looking for a Supplier Quality Engineer to continue to improve the quality from our suppliers of mechanical parts. At our Innovation Centre in Sweden, you will be a meaningful player in ensuring a fast and efficient supply chain that meets the demands from our production and our customers. We work in a global setting with suppliers all over the world in order to meet our customers’ expectations! Sounds exciting? Then keep reading.


**In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:**

* Drive supplier approval through supplier audits, both remote and on-site, and follow up with periodic audits.
* Communication related to supplier Key Performance Indicators regarding quality output and material deviations.
* Drive activities to improve the supplier quality performance in collaboration with the supplier.
* Participate in multi-functional supply chain and quality improvement activities.
* Perform parts qualification in product maintenance and development projects.

**Who You Are:**

You encourage others to learn and adopt new technologies. You serve as a strategic partner to build, grow, and maintain profitable and long-lasting relationships with key accounts. You quickly and decisively take actions in fact-changing, unpredictable situations. You create teamwork allowing others across the organization to achieve shared objectives. You effectively communicate in various settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels. You push yourself and help others achieve results.


**For This Role, You Will Need:**

* A degree in mechanical engineering or equivalent experience in similar positions within the industry.
* To be proficient in both verbal and written English and comfortable to operate in an international environment. If you speak Swedish as well, that is a plus.
* To enjoy working in a multi-functional environment, driving the supplier base to high quality standards.
* A personality that is willing to take action, with a personal drive to continuously improve quality and to get things done both individually and through others.

**Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:**

* Experience working with CMM Machine (Coordinate Measurement System)
Experience with Polyworks software  
* 

**Our Culture & Commitment to You**

At Emerson, we prioritize a workplace where every employee is valued, respected, and empowered to grow. We foster an environment that encourages innovation, collaboration, and diverse perspectives—because we know that great ideas come from great teams. Our commitment to ongoing career development and growing an inclusive culture ensures you have the support to thrive. Whether through mentorship, training, or leadership opportunities, we invest in your success so you can make a lasting impact. We believe diverse teams, working together are key to driving growth and delivering business results.
company_description: Emerson combines industry knowledge, manufacturing expertise, and technological innovation to offer a broad range of products and services.

title: Fuel material engineer
description:
At Westinghouse Electric Company, we are pioneers in nuclear technology and our technology is the basis for nearly half of the world's commercial nuclear power plants in operation. Today, we are also building several new reactors that contribute to more fossil-free energy. Globally, we have over 10,000 employees in 19 countries, of which 1,000 are at our Swedish workplaces in Västerås and Täby. Our Swedish operations were founded in 1969 and supply nuclear fuel as well as products and services in automation, maintenance, testing and decommissioning for customers around the world. Read more about us*www.westinghousenuclear.com**.*

  


**Fuel material engineer**

  


***Do you prioritize safety and quality with experience in metallic materials? Are you interested in working with advanced technology, together with a creative team? Do you also want to contribute to a better climate and a future filled with clean energy?***

  


Welcome to the department for Criticality Safety, Materials and Fuel Performance. a part of Westinghouse’s EMEA Fuel Engineering department. We are about 30 employees with a high level of expertise working with nuclear fuel materials, nuclear fuel performance and criticality.


You will be part of a group of materials specialists with a combined wealth of knowledge in metallic and ceramic materials and a lot of experience in production technology.

  


**Your contribution for a carbon-free future**


As a Fuel material engineer you will be an important part of the team to contribute to cross-functional projects aimed at developing the materials used in our nuclear fuels. Based on your expertise in metallic materials, you will:


* support our production facility with engineering challenges
* support purchasing in the selection and qualification of materials and suppliers

With us, you build a broad network of contacts within the factory organization and have great opportunities to develop in material issues but also in related areas. Within Fuel Engineering, we work with all commonly occurring reactor types and in addition to material issues, we also work in other technical disciplines such as thermohydraulic, core physics and software development to mention a few.


 You will work onsite at Bränslegatan, Västerås.

  


**We are looking for you**


To be a good match for this role, we believe that you are motivated by development and trust in your material expertise. You will typically participate in shorter as well as in multi-year projects. At Westinghouse we have a strong safety and quality culture and a belief that collaboration is a success factor and we hope you feel the same way.

  


**Qualifications**


* Master of science in engineering with focus on materials.
* Knowledge of relevant material issues in metallic materials, especially positive if you have expertise in Zirconium materials.
* Full professional proficiency in English and preferably Swedish, both spoken and written.

If you also have experience from nuclear power or nuclear fuel performance that is meritorious.

  


**Apply today!**


Welcome with your application including CV, cover letter and degree certificate. We interview candidates on a continuous basis, so please send in your application as soon as possible! Security clearance is carried out as part of the recruitment process.

  


You will report to Christofer Willman. For more information about the role, please contact the Christofer at willmack@westinghouse.com or +46 21 34 75 62

  


**Union agreement**


This role belongs to the union agreement Teknikavtalet.


**Union representatives**


Akademikerförening på Westinghouse (AFW): Anna Lundgren, +46 21 34 78 25, AFW@westinghouse.com


Unionen: Maria Gunnarsson, +46 21 347 595, gunnarmm@westinghouse.com


IF Metall: Zlatko Grbic, +46 732 367 035, grbicz@westinghouse.com


**We offer:**
-------------


At Westinghouse, we offer an inspiring work environment in a high-tech industry. You will be a part of a network of global experts from several different areas and we offer great opportunities for competence development and career growth, both in Sweden and abroad. As a member of our team, you will work together with engaged colleagues and be a part of an environment that is both challenging and supportive. Many of our positions are based in activity-based environments which enables a flexible workplace.


At Westinghouse, we have a strong safety culture.


Westinghouse is an employer that treats everyone equally.


**Some of the benefits employees in the Sweden can expect:**


* Wellness Allowance
* Flexible pay opportunities via our Benefit portal
* Work hour reduction (ATF) and occupational pension (ITP)
* ASB Insurance: compensation for the cost of health care, dental care hearing aids, glasses and more
* Employee Assistance Program: confidential counseling and resources for employees, eligible dependents, and household members
* Employee Referral Program: potential for employees to earn a monetary award for referring other qualified candidates to Westinghouse

title: Digital Radio Algorithm Design Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**


Would you like to join our cross-functional team as a Digital Radio Algorithm Developer at Ericsson and contribute to cutting-edge signal processing algorithms for 5G and 6G radios?

  

When developing radios, Ericsson always strives for the best radio performance on the market, but also the lowest cost and power consumption. With the immense computational power available today, the right answer to this design problem is often to make a low power-and-cost analog radio design and to then correct its shortcomings with digital signal processing. Our team specializes in algorithms that compensate for such imperfections in radio receivers, particularly for high-performance Analog to Digital Converters (ADCs). These algorithms are implemented in combinations of custom ASIC hardware and embedded software.

  

If you would like a role that is both broad and deep, where work is often research-like and ranges from deep theoretical analysis to practical lab work, then this could be the perfect fit for you. The position is placed at Lindholmen, Göteborg and involves daily collaboration with Ericsson teams in Sweden, Canada and China.

**What you will do**

* Explore, develop, simulate, optimize and tune digital signal processing algorithms for radio receivers
* Collaborate with ASIC and Software designers to implement the algorithms in ASICs and radio products
* Algorithm simulator programming
* Through measurements and analysis, you will validate and characterize the algorithms, ASIC’s and Software to guide future development.
* Keep educating and updating yourself on the subjects above; we work in a very dynamic field of technology.

 **The skills you bring**

* A MSc or PhD in Wireless Communication, Signal Processing, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Mathematics or related fields
* Solid technical skills in Statistical Signal Processing, Discrete Time Systems, Linear Algebra, Non-linear modelling, Optimization, Communications Theory and possibly Control Theory
* Proficiency in programming, particularly with MATLAB (C, C++, VHDL, Verilog & Python are also valuable)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and preferably Swedish
* Self-confidence and a can-do-attitude. You should like to create new things out of your imagination and to work your way through complex problems
* A humble willingness to learn, teach, coach and listen


In addition, we like you have:

* Understanding of Digital ASIC design with RTL and implementation aspects such as area, power consumption, fixed point numbers, polyphase techniques, clocking etc. Ability and willingness to do RTL design and verification
* Knowledge of high-performance RF ADC’s
* Practical lab work ability including RF measurements and test automation
* Proficiency in using Linux and Windows computer systems. Ability to solve everyday problems and write scripts as needed
* Analog /RF ASIC design experience
* Knowledge of real-time embedded systems design
* Experience with source code version control using GIT and Gerrit or similar
* Understanding of mobile communication standards (i.e. 3GPP)


Don't meet every single item on our wish list? No problem! We're looking for individuals who can grow and develop with our team.

  



**Application end date:** May 20, 2025

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
**Shape the future of payments with us!**
 Are you an experienced Frontend Engineer looking to build cutting-edge payment solutions? At Brite Payments, we’re transforming the industry with open banking technology, and we’re looking for a skilled Frontend Engineer to join our team. If you have a passion for creating seamless user experiences and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Develop, maintain, and optimize scalable applications using React, TypeScript, and modern frontend technologies.
* Translate designs into functional, responsive, and accessible user interfaces.
* Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and backend engineers to deliver high-performance solutions.
* Contribute to technical discussions, best practices, and architectural decisions.
* Ensure code quality, maintainability, and performance through best development practices and version control (Git).


**What we’re looking for:**

* Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Experience working with Git and modern version control workflows.
* A keen eye for detail and ability to collaborate effectively with designers.
* Strong communication skills in English.

**Nice to have:**
* Experience building projects from scratch and making architectural decisions.
* Some experience working with Angular.
* Familiarity with Figma and design systems.
* Experience optimizing web applications for performance and accessibility.


**Why join Brite?**
 Brite Payments, founded in 2019, is redefining payments across Europe with open banking-powered solutions. With over 160+ professionals across our offices in Stockholm, Malaga, Malta, and London, we offer a dynamic and collaborative environment where you can grow your career while working with cutting-edge technologies. We support professional development, provide learning opportunities, and offer flexible working hours in a hybrid environment to suit your needs.
   

  

**Ready to apply?**
 Let’s build the future of payments together! 🚀

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Junior Data Engineer – Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





 📍
 *Location: Stockholm – 3 days/week onsite* 




 💼
 *Full-time, Permanent* 




 🎁
 *Generous benefits package* 




  





 Are you passionate about data and eager to kickstart your career in a modern, forward-thinking tech environment? We’re looking for a
 **Junior Data Engineer** 
 to join a well-established, values-driven company with a strong foundation and long-term vision. Based in central Stockholm, this organization is part of a larger, family-owned group with over 140 years of history – providing stability, resources, and a commitment to innovation.
 



  





 You’ll join a high-performing Data & Analytics team working with modern tools and architectures in Azure. This is a great opportunity for someone who’s just starting out or has 1-2 years of experience and wants to take the next step in a supportive environment that encourages learning, experimentation, and ownership.
 



  





 🌟 What’s in it for you:
 


* **Exclusive opportunity** 
 - not advertised elsewhere
* **Work with top-tier colleagues** 
 - existing team members are highly skilled and collaborative
* **Modern cloud-based data stack** 
 - Azure, Databricks, Synapse, Fabric, and more
* **Freedom with responsibility** 
 - a flat, agile organization where your ideas matter
* **Excellent work-life balance** 
 - 30 days of vacation, wellness & healthcare allowance, and hybrid flexibility



  





 🛠️ What You’ll Be Doing:
 


* Building and maintaining robust, scalable data pipelines in Azure
* Supporting the design and development of data models and ETL processes
* Helping the organization leverage data for smarter decision-making
* Collaborating across departments to deliver business-driven data solutions



  





 🎓 What You Bring:
 


* Relevant academic background (e.g., Computer Science, IT Systems, Engineering)
* A strong interest in data engineering and analytics



 Either:
 


* Recent graduate with relevant studies and projects, OR
* 1-2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or BI development
* Exposure to SQL and either Python or Scala
* Understanding of data modelling and ETL concepts
* Fluent in
 **Swedish and English** 
 , both spoken and written



  





 ✅ Nice to Have:
 


* Experience with Microsoft Azure services like Data Factory, Synapse, or Databricks
* Knowledge of Power BI or Microsoft’s on-prem BI stack (SSIS, SSAS)
* Familiarity with object-oriented programming and agile methodologies



  





 🎁 Perks & Benefits:
 


* 30 days’ vacation
* Great pension plan
* 3,500 SEK annual wellness allowance (gym, etc.)
* 2,000 SEK annual healthcare allowance (dental, glasses, etc.)
* Amazing on-site restaurant (you’ll pay about a third of what you would in the city)
* Stable, purpose-driven organization with a long-term digital vision



  





 ❗ Additional Info:
 


* Swedish work permit or citizenship required (no visa sponsorship available)
* No travel required
* Hybrid setup: 3 days per week in the Stockholm office



  





 If you're excited to build your skills in a supportive team and help shape the future of data at a well-established, forward-looking company - we'd love to hear from you.
 



  





**Ready to take the next step? We’re excited to meet you.**

title: Kotlin Backend Engineer - Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for experienced Software Engineers to join various teams within the Merchant Group at Wolt! If you have a strong track record of building and maintaining scalable, production-grade systems and want to drive impact at scale, this is the place for you.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The Merchant Group consists of 150+ engineers across 25+ cross-functional teams, working together to help merchants grow their businesses and streamline operations through innovative technology. Some of us focus on building seamless experiences for our merchants, while others work on the behind-the-scenes magic that makes everything run smoothly.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As an engineer in our group, you’ll work on production-level microservices in Kotlin, helping shape how merchants succeed with Wolt. You’ll have opportunities to:
   

  

* Design, build, and scale reliable systems that power merchant experiences.
* Work across the full development lifecycle – from business logic and testing to cloud infrastructure and data streaming.
* Collaborate on architecture and technology choices that keep our systems simple, scalable, and efficient.
* Grow your skills and knowledge by working alongside experienced teammates in an environment that values learning and experimentation.


**How We Work**
* Autonomy & Ownership – Our engineers have end-to-end responsibility for their services, from implementation to production.
* Collaboration – Architecture and working methods are defined together, ensuring we make the best choices for long-term success.
* Scalability & Simplicity – We value pragmatic solutions that keep our systems robust without unnecessary complexity. We use technologies that serve Wolt, our teams, and our engineers best. You’ll have the freedom to experiment and adopt the tools that work.


 Find out more by checking out our Kotlin-related Tech Talks below:
   

  

* Scaling Kotlin Backend Development Podcast
* Kotlin at Wolt
* Kotlin Meetup


**Our Tech Stack**
 Our core technologies include Kotlin (Ktor, Koin, Spring, gRPC), PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Redis, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 No matter your level, Wolt is a place where you can learn, teach, and grow. If you’re passionate about building great technology and working in an environment that values teamwork and autonomy, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 📍These open roles can be based in our tech hubs in Helsinki, Stockholm and Tallinn. You can choose whether you want to work from home, from the office or hybrid.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We’re seeking experienced Software Engineers with a strong background in building scalable microservices. While Kotlin is our primary language, experience with Java, Scala, or other JVM backend languages is great - if you’re confident in your ability to learn, we’d love to hear from you! 🛠️
   

  

 Beyond technical expertise, we value ownership, collaboration, and a mindset for growth. You thrive in tackling complex challenges, questioning conventions, and working closely with teammates to build reliable, scalable systems. 🚀
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 We are hiring for multiple open positions across different teams in the Merchant Group. During the initial screening call our Talent Acquisition Partner will discuss with you your expectations and possible domain preferences as well as share more about the group. After the recruiter screening call, during the rest of the interviewing steps, you’ll meet hiring managers and software engineers from the Merchant group, a specific team being proposed at the end of the process - that’s the moment when you’ll get to meet your possible Team Lead. Throughout the process, we will do our best to match your experience, skills, and aspirations with the most suitable Engineering team!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Severi Kausola severi.kausola(at)wolt.com
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: iOS Engineer, Subscriptions Mission
description:
We're seeking a thoughtful iOS Engineer to become part of a truly collaborative team. You'll work alongside engineers from various teams, all driving towards shared goals. Our current focus is a massive undertaking: launching and scaling the new version of Spotify's free product. Your role spans the full spectrum – from hands-on feature development and real-world experimentation within our team, to partnering with engineers across the company on cross-team collaborations. This is a fantastic environment to grow your iOS development skills while working alongside experienced engineers on a high-impact product. The features and functionality you build with us will reach millions of users every day.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Help the squad deliver on its goals by working on hands-on feature development in a fast paced environment.
* Collaborate with engineers (iOS, Android and Backend), engineering manager, product manager, designers and data scientists to come up with the best possible solutions for the problems the squad is tasked with solving.
* Set up experiments with the functionality we build to help Spotify learn and improve.
* Participate actively in code reviews (both giving and receiving feedback) to maintain quality and learn best practices.
* Contribute to the overall Spotify platform within the iOS domain.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have good communication skills and can articulate your ideas and ask clarifying questions.
* You possess a strong desire to learn quickly, embrace feedback, and continuously improve your technical skills.
* You enjoy thinking through problems and collaborating to find pragmatic solutions.
* You care about quality and know what it means to ship high-quality code.
* You have foundational knowledge of Swift and key iOS SDKs (e.g., SwiftUI)
* You believe in the power of teamwork for achieving goals and thrive on collaborating with colleagues throughout the company.
* You have at least 2 years of iOS development experience.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Data Scientist / AI Expert
description:
Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of generative AI and eager to work with cutting-edge technologies like Large Language Models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and multimodal data systems? Join our innovative team at ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems and contribute to building intelligent, AI-powered solutions that make a real difference. Based in Stockholm, Sweden, this position offers an exciting opportunity to work hands-on with innovative tools and collaborate with cross-functional teams, all while growing your career in a dynamic and supportive environment. In this role, you'll thrive in a collaborative, innovative culture that empowers you to build a career to be proud of.
   

  

 This is a 6-month position with the possibility to continue as a permanent employee.
   

  

**What you will do as our Data Scientist / AI Expert**
 As a Data Scientist / AI Expert, you will Develop and optimize Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines using Python, integrating databases, APIs, and knowledge graphs into scalable AI systems.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Work with multimodal datasets—including text, images, and relational data—embedding them effectively into advanced AI frameworks
* Fine-tune Large Language Models (LLMs) for specific business tasks and domains using prompt engineering and performance evaluation techniques
* Create and orchestrate intelligent AI agents to support advanced reasoning, decision-making, and strategic prompting
* Implement and execute testing protocols to evaluate model effectiveness, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and contextual relevance
* Stay up to date with advancements in generative AI, integrating new techniques to enhance business capabilities


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has 3+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning and AI, including experience acquired through relevant academic studies or a PhD
* Has a solid experience in Python programming, with a strong understanding of software development and AI/ML technologies
* Is proficient in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture and fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs)
* Is proficient in English, other languages are advantageous
* Has a strong capabilities in building and deploying intelligent agents and managing AI workflows


 The ideal candidate is a strong analytical thinker with a creative approach to solving complex AI challenges. They are adaptable, continuously learning and applying the latest AI techniques, and capable of balancing independent initiative with effective collaboration. Clear and confident in communication, they can present complex technical concepts to diverse audiences. Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS is a plus.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We are passionate about providing opportunities and benefits, so that you can continue a lifelong career with us. Here is what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it is online learning, management training or enhancing your skills
* A competitive salary
* The opportunity to work with a great group of people in a dynamic and cooperative environment


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us.
   

  

 To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let's together create a safer and more open world!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.co
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Data Engineer
description:
My client is a leading European IT services provider, offering innovative and high-quality technology solutions to businesses across various industries.
 



  





 With over 9000 employees, this organisation has a strong focus on digital transformation, delivering end-to-end services ranging from cloud computing, data analytics, and IT infrastructure management to software development and system integration.
 



  





 The company prides itself on its family feel and customer-centric approach, working closely with clients to understand their unique needs and provide tailored solutions that drive efficiency and business growth.
 



  





 This organisation have offices across Europe – including significant operations in the Benelux and Nordic regions.
 



  





 As a result of growth they are looking for talented Data Engineers and Consultants to join the growing practice in Sweden which currently employs around 60 people.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 




  




* Design and build robust data pipelines using Microsoft Azure technologies.
* Develop and optimize data storage solutions using SQL Server, Azure SQL, or Cosmos DB.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources.
* Implement scalable data processing and analytics solutions.



  





**Skills We're Looking For:** 




  




* Proficiency in Microsoft Azure (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics).
* Strong SQL programming skills and experience with relational databases.
* Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
* Ability to work in an agile environment and manage multiple priorities.



  





**Why Join Us:** 




  




* Opportunity to work on innovative projects using cutting-edge Microsoft Technologies.
* Collaborative and inclusive work culture that values creativity and growth.
* Competitive compensation package with excellent benefits (including wellness allowance, insurances and 30 days vacation).



  





  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Senior Mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 20 års erfarenhet
* Expertkunskap i Java
* Goda färdigheter i minst ett ytterligare programmeringsspråk
* Goda kunskaper i hur versionshantering fungerar (Git/CVS/etc.)
* Goda kunskaper i hur man arbetar agilt (Scrum/Kanban)
* Goda kunskaper i Linux
* Goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska, både i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av Ada
* Kunskaper i olika byggsystem (Jenkins, Make, etc.)
* Kunskaper i virtualisering, nätverk och IT-säkerhet
* Vana att arbeta i flera olika programmeringsspråk/ramverk


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 14-05-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: AI-strateg
description:
**Vill du bli en del av vårt Data Analytics och AI-team? Här får du chansen att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och hantera ett brett spektrum av utmaningar. Vi arbetar med olika projekt inom AI och generativ AI, samt utför traditionell dataanalys. Vi använder olika plattformar men mycket sker inom Microsofts AI Plattform med t.ex Azure Open AI, Azure AI Foundry och Copilot Studio. Utöver detta så hjälper vi även kunder på ett strategiskt plan med rådgivning, AI-Strategier och AI-Policys.**
 Ökad efterfrågan och nya uppdrag gör att vi behöver förstärka vårt
 **Data Analytics och AI-team** 
 . Vi söker personer med erfarenhet inom dataanalys/AI och gärna med kompetens inom Microsofts AI Plattform. Med starkt samarbete med Microsoft och andra plattformar erbjuder vi spännande framtidsutsikter och projekt i våra leveransteam.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra hos oss?**
 Som AI-strateg kommer du rådge kunder och hjälpa dem med att utforma AI-strategier, AI-roadmaps och designa nya AI-projekt.
   

  

**Känner du igen dig?**
 Vi tror att du har en hög social förmåga och trivs i gränslandet kund/lösning/teknik/verksamhet. Du är van att ha en ledande roll både internt och hos kund. Du behöver vara strukturerad och självgående.
   

  

**Vi tror att du:**
 – Har Högskole- eller universitetsutbildning, sannolikt inom system- och datavetenskap eller motsvarande utbildning
   

  

 – Har erfarenhet av IT- eller Verksamhetsarkitektur
   

  

 – Troligen jobbat med dataflöden och data management
   

  

 – Har jobbat inom IT helst med mjukvaruutveckling i minst 10 år
   

  

 – Kan Azure Stacken och Azure AI stacken (Azure Open AI, Azure AI Foundry och Copilot Studio)
   

  

 – Behärskar databearbetning och dataanalys
   

  

 – Gillar siffror, data och AI
   

  

 – Inte tvekar att ta itu med utmaningar och ny teknik
   

  

 – Har kommunikativ förmåga och utrycker dig väl i svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Vi tror också att du är erfaren inom flera av nedanstående områden:**
 – Systemutveckling
   

  

 – MS Fabric, MS Factory, Power BI
   

  

 – Integrationer
   

  

 – Molntjänster exempelvis Azure
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig:**
 – Att tillsammans med andra bygga viktiga saker, som spelar roll
   

  

 – Friskvårdsbidrag, kollektivavtal, tjänstepension och brett utbud av aktiviteter
   

  

 – Flexibel arbetstid och balans mellan arbete & fritid
   

  

 – Stark kollegial anda i ekonomiskt stabilt företag.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi på Softronic jobbar ständigt med att förﬂytta våra kunder mot morgondagens teknik. Vare sig det handlar om att utveckla AI, automatisera processer eller modernisera en äldre lösning med bibehållen tillgänglighet. En annan sida av det vi gör är att vi hjälper våra kunder att utveckla innovativa och driftsäkra tjänster som skapar samhällsnytta genom att förenkla människors liv och jobb. På så sätt blir vi och vår teknik en positiv kraft i samhället och en del i att göra världen lite mer hållbar. Det är det vi kallar GoodTech.
   

  

 Vi ser arbetet och arbetsplatsen som en av flera energigivande delar i människans liv. Därför odlar vi aktivt en kultur av gemenskap och lust, där brädspelskvällar, löprundor med kollegorna längs vattnet eller en ﬁka på terrassen är viktigt och ska få lov att ta plats. Genom gemenskap och samhörighet blir det också enklare att tillsammans vidareutveckla våra förmågor, för att i förlängningen kunna vässa vårt erbjudande mot våra kunder.

title: D365 F&O Technical Rollout Manager
description:
Our client, a leading global multinational information technology services and consulting company, is recruiting a
 **D365 F&O Technical Rollout Manager,** 
 to join their business in
 **Sweden.** 




  





  





**Position Title:** 




**D365 F&O Technical Rollout Manager** 




  





**Position Type:** 




 Permanent
 



  





**Start Date:** 




 ASAP
 



  





**Location:** 




 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





**Contact:** 




 Bojan | +49 89 23 88 98 671
 



  





  





**Responsibilities:** 




  




* 12 + yrs of Experience in D365 FO
* Dynamics technical design and development experience (X++, C#, SSRS and BI development)
* Minimum of 3-4 MS full life cycle Dynamics 365 F&O implementations projects in a role of a Developer, Technical consultants or Technical Architect, experience with Visual Studio and in .NET development
* Experience in upgrading to the latest releases of Dynamics 365 (code and data upgrade).
* Testing Using RSAT.
* Experience in complex data migration (using DIXF, third party tools, Atlas and custom development:
* Environment deployment
* Experience in performance optimization (X++ application code, troubleshooting D365 components, AXPerf, LCS Environment monitoring, SQL performance optimization)
* Experience in environment and release management (ALM, TFS, Build processes, Environment management, Installation and configuration of AX and related components)
* Good to have: Finance modules (GL/AP/AR/Project /Budgeting/Fixed assets/Expense/Multi company accounting etc)
* Should have done at least 3 successful implementations.
